intro: Indigofera unifoliolata, commonly known as the single leaf indigo plant, is a leguminous shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single leaflet per leaf, which gives it its scientific name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, typical of the Fabaceae family. Indigofera unifoliolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures.
